channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY

item.title: Report X-2023090880
item.description:
Report X-2023090880

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-18T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-13
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A package handler dropped the plastic drum causing its top to wedge open and spill. We cleaned up the spill with neutralizer. We secured the package and soiled clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Top wedged open due to being dropped DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Top was secured back on and package was placed in a lined red tote.

item.description:
Report X-2023090850

  • City: INDEPENDENCE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap became loose causing a spill. We used neutralizer to clean the area. We secured the package and soild clean up materials in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Cap became loose1 DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightened

item.title: Report X-2023090669
item.description:
Report X-2023090669

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-17T15:12:35+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-09-11
  • City: PADUCAH
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded and communicated that package was wet. Package was isolated, area inspected, and then brought to the cage for further inspection. Package was then inspected and found that one of the seals under the caps had eroded. DescribePack: Package failed from one of the four jugs inside having eroded seals underneath causing the degreaser to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Leak proof totes lined with a hazmat bag were staged nearby while management communicated immediately when the leak was found.

item.title: Report E-2023080198
item.description:
Report E-2023080198

Identified by scraper @ 2023-10-14T00:31:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-25
  • City: RUSSELL
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/25/2023, personnel at CSX Russel, KY yard, reported UTLX671478, a loaded tank car of Xylenols, was observed leaking from the top of the car. The car was isolated and SASOL Chemicals was notified via CHEMTREC (report #2023-07-25-00337). Quick Response, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found (1) of (8) manway cover bolts less than tool tight. The manway bolts were tightened tool tight and the released Xylenols was cleaned from the top of the car. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to SASOL Chemicals representative Randy Shilling (832-783-6428, Randy.Shilling@us.sasol.com). Delay in report submission due to online portal would not accept.
